definitions.definition: Stunningly beautiful; amazing
definitions.example: He went to the Grand Canyon and spent a week taking in the breathtaking scenery all around him.

definitions.definition: Very surprising or shocking; to such a degree as to cause astonishment.
definitions.example: breathtaking stupidity or rudeness

definitions.definition: Reduced to essentials; without additional features.
definitions.example: It was the stripped-down version that they bought.

definitions.definition: The leaves and tender parts of the Indian hemp plant (which are intoxicating), which are dried for either chewing or smoking.
A cannabis extract.
Marijuana generally.
A form of malnutrition, found in children, caused by dietary insufficiency of protein in combination with a high-carbohydrate diet.
To break down and reuse component materials.
definitions.example: Both paper and plastic can be recycled.

definitions.definition: To reuse as a whole.
To collect or place in a bin for recycling.
To be recycled.
definitions.example: Sulfur recycles in the sulfur cycle.

definitions.definition: To discard into a recycling bin.
The practice of sorting and collecting waste materials for new use.
Those materials culled for recycling.
definitions.example: He plans to haul the recycling in on Saturday.

definitions.definition: To be close to death, to be dying

word: have one foot in the grave

definitions.definition: Fighting with a sword
definitions.example: His expertise at swordplay made his acting in the part of Hamlet very believable.

definitions.definition: Lacking employment.
definitions.example: a jobless man

definitions.definition: The royal poinciana (Delonix regia), a showy tropical tree.
Showy, bold or audacious in behaviour, appearance, etc.
Referring to the final stage of French Gothic architecture from the 14th to the 16th centuries.
A mark made by smearing.
definitions.example: This detergent cleans windows without leaving smears.

definitions.definition: Any of various forms of distortion that make a signal harder to see or hear.
A Pap smear.
definitions.example: I'm going to the doctor's this afternoon for a smear.

definitions.definition: A false attack.
A maneuver in which the shoe is placed onto the holdless rock, and the friction from the shoe keeps it in contact
A rough glissando in jazz music.
To spread (a substance, especially one that colours or is dirty) across a surface by rubbing.
definitions.example: The artist smeared paint over the canvas in broad strokes.

definitions.definition: To have a substance smeared on (a surface).
definitions.example: She smeared her lips with lipstick.

definitions.definition: To damage someone's reputation by slandering, misrepresenting, or otherwise making false accusations about an individual, their statements, or their actions.
definitions.example: The opposition party attempted to smear the candidate by spreading incorrect and unverifiable rumors about their personal behavior.

definitions.definition: To become spread by smearing.
definitions.example: The paint is still wet — don't touch it or it will smear.

definitions.definition: To climb without using footholds, using the friction from the shoe to stay on the wall.
Any of several South American flowering shrubs or lianas, of the genus Bougainvillea, having three showy, colorful bracts attached below each group of three inconspicuous flowers.
Either of two species of deep-water fish, Latimeria chalumnae of the Indian Ocean and Latimeria menadoensis of Indonesia.
Any lobe-finned fish in the order Coelacanthiformes, thought until 1938 to have been extinct for 70 million years.
Someone who finds suitable dates or marriage partners for other people.
(by extension) Someone who arranges professional boxing matches.
Someone who makes matchsticks.
A short sword with a curved blade, and a convex edge; once used by sailors when boarding an enemy ship.
A similarly shaped tool; a machete.
To cut back (vegetation) with a cutlass.
Any building used by a club for meetings or social activities.
A locker room and possibly associated rooms used by an athletic team.
A building at a golf course that houses various activities associated with golf.
A garment made of a length of printed cloth wrapped about the waist that is commonly worn by men and women in Malaysia, Sri Lanka, India, Indonesia, and the Pacific islands.
An area dominated by grass or grasslike vegetation.
A body search where the person's clothes are removed.
To remove the clothes of (a person) and perform a body search on them.
Interested in the latest fashions, and in wearing fashionable clothes.
To regulate, adjust or adapt
To change the pitch, intensity or tone of one's voice or of a musical instrument
To vary the amplitude, frequency or phase of a carrier wave in proportion to the amplitude etc of a source wave (such as speech or music)
To move from one key or tonality to another, especially by using a chord progression
A fearful state; a state of concern or hesitation.
definitions.example: I decided, with considerable trepidation, to let him drive my car without me.

definitions.definition: An involuntary trembling, sometimes an effect of paralysis, but usually caused by terror or fear; quaking; quivering.
A libration of the starry sphere in the Ptolemaic system; a motion ascribed to the firmament, to account for certain small changes in the position of the ecliptic and of the stars.
A person who rents a room.
(in combination) A residence having the specified number of rooms.
At a greater distance; farther off.
A cheap pulp novel produced in 19th-century America.
A man who is engaged to be married.
A person engaged to be married.
An element of decoration; that which embellishes or adorns.
A Christmas tree decoration.
A musical flourish that is unnecessary to the overall melodic or harmonic line, but serves to decorate or "ornament" that line.
(in the plural) The articles used in church services.
A characteristic that has a decorative function (typically in order to attract a mate)
To decorate.
definitions.example: We will ornament the windows with trim to make the room seem brighter.

definitions.definition: To add to.
definitions.example: The editor ornamented his plain writing, making it fancier but less clear.

definitions.definition: The act of progressing or proceeding.
A group of people or things moving along in an orderly, stately, or solemn manner; a train of persons advancing in order; a retinue.
definitions.example: a procession of mourners; the Lord Mayor's procession

definitions.definition: A number of things happening in sequence (in space or in time).
(in the plural) Litanies said in procession and not kneeling.
To take part in a procession.
To honour with a procession.
(North Carolina and Tennessee) To ascertain, mark, and establish the boundary lines of (lands).
A covered and enclosed entrance to a building, whether taken from the interior, and forming a sort of vestibule within the main wall, or projecting without and with a separate roof.
A portico; a covered walk.
The platform outside the external hatch of a spacecraft.
Of or pertaining to heresy or heretics.
(of ideas or views) Contrary to mainstream or accepted opinion.
To make clear or effective.
To speak clearly; to enunciate.
definitions.example: I wish he’d articulate his words more clearly.

definitions.definition: To explain; to put into words; to make something specific.
definitions.example: I like this painting, but I can’t articulate why.

definitions.definition: To bend or hinge something at intervals, or to allow or build something so that it can bend.
definitions.example: an articulated bus

definitions.definition: To attack a note, as by tonguing, slurring, bowing, etc.
definitions.example: Articulate that passage heavily.

definitions.definition: To form a joint or connect by joints
definitions.example: The lower jaw articulates with the skull at the temporomandibular joint.

definitions.definition: To treat or make terms.
An articulated vehicle, such as a locomotive.
Constructed with one or more pivoted joints which allow bending of an otherwise rigid structure.
Of a vehicle, composed of component parts each with its own wheels and chassis, e.g. an articulated lorry, articulated bus, or certain kinds of streetcars and trains.
Of a person, having a lot of hair on the body.
definitions.example: a hairy man

definitions.definition: Of an animal, having a lot of fur.
definitions.example: hairy mammoth

definitions.definition: Of a body part other than the head, having hair growing from it.
definitions.example: She is a great admirer of hairy chests.

definitions.definition: Difficult, complex, intricate, or intimidating.
definitions.example: It’s a hairy problem, and will probably take several weeks to sort out.

definitions.definition: Causing anxiety or fright; terrifying, scary.
Thorough; utter; dyed-in-the-wool
Kind and warmly courteous
Tactful
Compassionate
Indulgent, charming and graceful
Elegant and with good taste
Benignant
Full of grace
Expression of surprise, contempt, outrage, disgust, boredom, frustration.
A warrant officer belonging to one of the two classes of chief petty officer: chief petty officer first class and chief petty officer second class.
A non-commissioned officer in the Royal Navy, ranking above petty officer and below warrant officer class 2.
A non-commissioned officer in the United States Navy and United States Coast Guard, ranking above petty officer first class and below senior chief petty officer.
A man's necktie tied in a bow around the throat.
A kind of road intersection. See Bowtie (road).
The act of inhibiting.
A personal feeling of fear or embarrassment that stops one behaving naturally.
The process of stopping or retarding a reaction.
A writ from a higher court to an inferior judge to stay proceedings.
A recusal.
Of food, drink, cosmetics etc.: created without the use of ingredients that some consumers prefer to avoid, such as allergens or animal products.
A bet or wager.
definitions.example: I had a gamble on the horses last weekend.

definitions.definition: A significant risk, undertaken with a potential gain.
A risky venture.
definitions.example: The sailors had taken many gambles with the sea and always won.

definitions.definition: To take a risk, with the potential of a positive outcome.
To play risky games, especially casino games, for monetary gain.
To risk (something) for potential gain.
definitions.example: He gambled his reputation on the outcome.

definitions.definition: To interact with equipment at a casino
Any of three species of genus Equus: E. grevyi, E. quagga, or E. zebra, all with black and white stripes and native to Africa.
A referee.
An unlikely diagnosis, especially for symptoms probably caused by a common ailment. (Originates in the advice often given to medical students: "when you hear hoofbeats, think of horses, not zebras".)
A biracial person, specifically one born to a member of the Sub-Saharan African race and a Caucasian.
A fish, the zebra cichlid.
Any of various papilionid butterflies of the subgenus Paranticopsis of the genus Graphium, having black and white markings.
To rotate, revolve, gyrate (usually quickly); to partially or completely rotate to face another direction.
definitions.example: I spun myself around a few times.

definitions.definition: To make yarn by twisting and winding fibers together.
definitions.example: They spin the cotton into thread.

definitions.definition: To present, describe, or interpret, or to introduce a bias or slant, so as to give something a favorable or advantageous appearance.
(of a bowler) To make the ball move sideways when it bounces on the pitch.
(of a ball) To move sideways when bouncing.
To form into thin strips or ribbons, as with sugar
To form (a web, a cocoon, silk, etc.) from threads produced by the extrusion of a viscid, transparent liquid, which hardens on coming into contact with the air; said of the spider, the silkworm, etc.
To shape, as malleable sheet metal, into a hollow form, by bending or buckling it by pressing against it with a smooth hand tool or roller while the metal revolves, as in a lathe.
To move swiftly.
definitions.example: to spin along the road in a carriage, on a bicycle, etc.

definitions.definition: To stream or issue in a thread or a small current or jet.
definitions.example: Blood spins from a vein.

definitions.definition: To wait in a loop until some condition becomes true.
To play (vinyl records, etc.) as a disc jockey.
To use an exercise bicycle, especially as part of a gym class.
An abnormal condition in journal bearings where the bearing seizes to the shaft that is rotating and rotates inside the journal, destroying both the shaft and the journal.
The motion of something that spins.
The process of converting fibres into yarn or thread.
Indoor cycling on an exercise bicycle.
Rapidly rotating on an axis; whirling.
A period of excellent performance where nearly everything seems to go right, contrasting with a lower general level of performance.
definitions.example: The England team hit a purple patch just after half-time, where they scored 3 goals in 10 minutes, but in the end they were lucky to escape with a 3-3 draw.

definitions.definition: An ornate or elaborate section of a written work; a patch of purple prose.
Bread made using sour milk and baking soda as a rising agent, rather than yeast; common in Ireland.
(authorship) To write under the name of another (especially literary works).
definitions.example: Mariana would rather not ghostwrite for a living because she finds it a thankless task.

definitions.definition: (authorship) To author a literary work or speech in the place of another.
definitions.example: The president has someone to ghostwrite his addresses.

definitions.definition: The socialist and communist philosophy and political program founded by Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels.

The socialist and communist theory of the followers of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels; a radical, revolutionary political philosophy that aims to capture state power, introduce a dictatorship of the proletariat, and then progress to communism.
Disgrace, dishonour.
Defamation; slander, libel.
To disgrace; to bring into disrepute.
To charge; to accuse (someone) of an offence.
To harm or diminish the reputation of; to disparage.
definitions.example: to defame somebody

definitions.definition: (used attributively as a modifier) Of or relating to trousers.
definitions.example: trouser leg

definitions.definition: (in clothing retail and fashion) A pair of trousers.
definitions.example: And this is our linen trouser, sir.

definitions.definition: To put money into one's trouser pocket; to pocket.
To legally remove funds from an organization for personal use.
To secretively steal an item or money for personal use.
To import or export, illicitly or by stealth, without paying lawful customs charges or duties
To bring in surreptitiously
To fondle or cuddle.
To thrash or be thrashed by a bear's claws, or to swipe at or be swiped at by a person's arms in a bearlike manner.
One of several natural languages, typically used by the deaf, in which words and phrases are represented by hand shapes, motions, positions, and facial expressions.
The sign language (sense 1) that is used locally or that is mistakenly believed to be the only one.
Sign languages (sense 1) considered collectively.
(countable or uncountable) Communication through gestures used when speech is impossible, for example, between monks under a vow of silence or people speaking different languages.
Yes; an answer that shows agreement or acceptance.
definitions.example: 10-4 good buddy. That's an affirmative - the tractor trailer is in the ditch at the side of the highway.

definitions.definition: (grammar) An answer that shows agreement or acceptance.
An assertion.
Pertaining to truth; asserting that something is; affirming
definitions.example: an affirmative answer

definitions.definition: Pertaining to any assertion or active confirmation that favors a particular result
Positive
definitions.example: an affirmative vote

definitions.definition: Confirmative; ratifying.
definitions.example: an act affirmative of common law

definitions.definition: Dogmatic
Expressing the agreement of the two terms of a proposition.
Positive; not negative
An elaborate synonym for the word yes.
(especially radio communications) Yes; true; correct.
A person who is able to read and write.
A person who was educated but had not taken a university degree; especially a candidate to take holy orders.
Able to read and write; having literacy.
Knowledgeable in literature, writing; literary; well-read.
Which is used in writing (of a language or dialect).
A bright red and black butterfly, Vanessa atalanta, of the family Nymphalidae.
The act of mortifying.
A sensation of extreme shame or embarrassment.
The death of part of the body.
A bringing under of the passions and appetites by a severe or strict manner of living.
A bequest to a charitable institution.
A sailor or mariner.
One who travels by sea.
Any of a group of steroids that are secreted by the ovaries and function as female sex hormones.
In a glorious manner.
Acting too quickly without considering the risks and consequences; not careful; hasty.
definitions.example: rash words spoken in the heat of debate

definitions.definition: So dry as to fall out of the ear with handling, as corn.
Requiring sudden action; pressing; urgent.
Fast-acting.
A strip of bacon.
To cut into rashers.
To declare openly and boldly, as something believed to be right; to own, acknowledge or confess frankly.
To bind or devote by a vow.
To acknowledge and justify, as an act done. See avowry.
Openly acknowledged
Positively stated
Asserted under oath, or vow
(usually in the plural) a string or strip of pasta
definitions.example: She slurped a long noodle up out of her soup.

definitions.definition: A person with poor judgement; a fool
The brain, the head
A pool noodle
To think or ponder.
definitions.example: "Noodle that thought around for a while" said Dr. Johnson to his Biblical Interpretations class.

definitions.definition: To fiddle, play with, or mess around.
definitions.example: If the machine is really broken, noodling with the knobs is not going to fix it.

definitions.definition: To improvise music.
definitions.example: He has been noodling with that trumpet all afternoon, and every bit of it sounds awful.

definitions.definition: To fish (usually for very large catfish) without any equipment other than the fisherman's own body
definitions.example: Fred had several lacerations on his hands from noodling for flathead in the river.

definitions.definition: To fossick, especially for opals.
A period in a civilization's development when the most advanced metalworking has developed the techniques of smelting copper from natural outcroppings and alloys it to cast bronze.
One of the Classical Ages of Man, associated with warfare.
An athletics event in which contestants compete in swimming, cycling and running in turn.
A former Olympic athletics event in which contestants compete in long jump, shot put, and 100-yard dash.
Generally, a sports event in which contestant compete in a combination of three sports.
A rod, wire, or other structure for receiving or transmitting radio, television signals etc.
A move, as in dancing or skateboarding, involving one or both feet leaving the ground.
Aerial photography.
Living or taking place in the air.
definitions.example: The seabirds put on an astonishing aerial display.

definitions.definition: Made up of air or gas; gaseous.
Positioned high up; elevated.
definitions.example: The aerial photographs clearly showed the damage caused by the storm.

definitions.definition: Ethereal, insubstantial; imaginary.
Pertaining to the air or atmosphere; atmospheric.
Pertaining to a vehicle which travels through the air; airborne; relating to or conducted by means of aircraft.
Above the ground
A birth defect resulting in a cleft in the spinal column through which the spinal membranes and spinal cord may protrude. It is characterised by hydrocephalus and other neurological disorders.
A person employed in the civil service; a government employee.
The cancellation or postponement of a punishment.
A document authorizing such an action.
Relief from pain etc., especially temporary.
To cancel or postpone the punishment of someone, especially an execution.
To bring relief to someone.
To take back to prison (in lieu of execution).
To discipline (one's body, appetites etc.) by suppressing desires; to practise abstinence on.
definitions.example: Some people seek sainthood by mortifying the body.

definitions.definition: (usually used passively) To embarrass, to humiliate. To injure one's dignity.
definitions.example: I was so mortified I could have died right there; instead I fainted, but I swore I'd never let that happen to me again.

definitions.definition: To kill.
To reduce the potency of; to nullify; to deaden, neutralize.
To kill off (living tissue etc.); to make necrotic.
To affect with vexation, chagrin, or humiliation; to humble; to depress.
To grant in mortmain.
To lose vitality.
To gangrene.
To be subdued.
Mortification; abstinence
definitions.example: mortifyings of the flesh

definitions.definition: Causing mortification; extremely embarrassing.
A mean, worthless fellow; a rascal; a villain; a person without honour or virtue.
Evil, especially considered as an active force for destruction or death.
Suffering, woe, torment.
A large fire, a conflagration or bonfire.
A funeral pyre.
A beacon-fire.
A rounded bundle or package of goods in a cloth cover, and corded for storage or transportation.
A bundle of compressed wool or hay, compacted for shipping and handling.
A measurement of hay equal to 10 flakes. Approximately 70-90 lbs (32-41 kg).
A measurement of paper equal to 10 reams.
To remove water from a boat with buckets etc.
A form of exercise, designed to enhance one's cardiovascular fitness, normally performed to music.
A marinara sauce.
Prepared with tomatoes, or in a tomato sauce.
Of pasta: In a seafood sauce. Of pizza: With seafood topping.
Use of numerical data to inform social programs.
definitions.example: Using social engineering, the new cardinal has efficiently re-arranged the Church's outreach.

definitions.definition: Efforts to influence attitudes and social behaviors on a large scale, in order to produce desired characteristics in a target population.
The practice of tricking a user into giving, or giving access to, sensitive information, thereby bypassing most or all protection.
definitions.example: After our hacking attempts failed, we tried social engineering, walking into the building and claiming we had to do some urgent work in the server room.

definitions.definition: A wearisome journey.
A short excursion for pleasure or refreshment; a ramble; a short journey.
To ramble here and there; to stroll; to make an excursion.
To ride on a jaunting car.
To jolt; to jounce.
Any of several African mammals of the family Bovidae distinguished by hollow horns, which, unlike deer, they do not shed.
The pronghorn, Antilocapra americana.
A fierce legendary creature said to live on the banks of the Euphrates, having long serrated horns and being hard to catch.
The floor of a building at the level of the street or surrounding ground; the ground floor
The floor of a building one above the ground floor
A bath in which an additive is poured directly into the water that creates bubbles.
A soap-based product to be added to a bath to create bubbles.
A laugh.
definitions.example: Are you having a bubble bath?!
